_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Lincolnway Energy, LLC

Lincolnway Energy, LLC is a newly constructed facility.  Many of the reports and information have only recently been developed.  Given that Lincolnway Energy, LLC is a new facility, there has been constant review and revisions to reports and information prior to the start up of the facility.  On the same note, there has never been a change in management.  The management is "new" and therefore, the "new" management was implemented with the construction of the facility. 

Accidental Release Prevention and Response Policies:

Lincolnway Energy, LLC has a commitment to worker and public safety.  This commitment is demonstrated in the resources invested in accident prevention, such as training personnel as well as considering safety in the design, installation, operation, and maintenance of the facility.

Lincolnway Energy, LLC 's policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances.  However, if a release does occur, plant personnel will respond to contain the release as necessary.

Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances:

Lincolnway Energy, LLC ethanol plant is located in Nevada, Story County, Iowa.

The facility operates 24 hours per day, 7 days per week for the purpose of manufacturing fuel grade ethanol from corn.  The regulated substances under the RMP program are Anhydrous Ammonia, Propoane and Denaturant (also known as natural gasoline which is a flammable mixture Lincolnway Energy, LLC has determined that the radius of impact from a worst-case release of ammonia would be about 6.9  miles, worst case for propane would be 0.4 miles and a worst-case release of denaturant would be about 0.6 miles.  Due to the amount of ammonia, propane and denaturant stored on site, Lincolnway Energy would be considered a Program 3.

Off-site Consequence Analysis Results:

The worst case scenario at the facility is the release of all 162,000 pounds of a

mmonia creating a toxic cloud or release 924,000 pounds of denaturant causing a vapor cloud explosion or a release of 169,295 pounds of propane released as a vapor cloud.  

For ammonia, the worst-case scenario is based on the release of all ammonia stored on site.  The worst case vapor cloud endpoint is approximately 6.9 miles from the center of the plant.  Residence homes, schools and other public receptors are located within this 6.9 mile radius.

For denaturant, the worst-case scenario is based on the release of all denaturant stored on site.  The worst case vapor cloud endpoint is approximately 0.5 miles from the center of the plant.  Residence homes and other public receptors are located within this 0.5 mile radius.

For propane, the worst-case scenario is based on the release of all propane stored on site.  The worst case vapor cloud endpoint is approximately 0.4 miles from the center of the plant.  Residence homes are located within this 0.5 mile radius.

Although Lincolnway Energy, LLC has numerous controls in place to prevent such a release and to manage potential consequences, no credit for administrative controls or passive mitigation measures were taken into account in evaluating this scenario.

The facility qualifies as a Program 3 due to the close proximity of public receptors, and therefore, Program Safety Management has been completed for this facility.

Five Year Accident History:

Lincolnway Energy, LLC has constructed a new ethanol facility and is subject to RMP upon delivery of substances onsite.  There have been no accidents since the establishment of Lincolnway Energy, LLC.

Emergency Response Program Information:

Lincolnway Energy, LLC ethanol plant has several safety programs in place at the facility that incorporate emergency response, including a Health and Safety Plan.  An SPCC will be prepared and implemented in accordance with applicable regulatory standards and timeframes.

The facility also conducts employee training as part of facil
ity activities.  Lincolnway Energy, LLC 's corporate policy places the utmost importance on worker, public and environmental safety, which is reflected in facility plans and training activities.
